result.markdown:
---
title: "How to map your neighborhood using the {overedge} and {birdseyeview} R packages"
date: "2022-03-06"
---


## Introduction

-   Background

    -   Flickr photos for Baltimore Heritage and demolition data
    -   311 reports
    -   Public art database in Airtable and in Open Street Map

-   Work

    -   Visualization
    -   Advocacy
    -   Decision-making support

-   Packages

    -   overedge
    -   birdseyeview (new)

## Why another package

-   Many packages doing many different things can be difficult to navigate

-   Reduce complexity of code when creating basic maps/visualizations

-   Increase adaptability of code to facilitate quick response (e.g. [Mondawmin](https://twitter.com/elipousson/status/1366578889158516738))

-   Challenge bad data analysis (e.g. [The Block](https://twitter.com/elipousson/status/1485457434042937348))

-   Difficult of adapting

-   Goals for new packages

    -   Fast to use and adapt at different scales
    -   Consistent and interoperable with common packages (sf, ggplot2, gt, tigris, mapboxapi)
    -   Use and promote open data practices

-   What do new packages do

    -   overedge
    -   birdseyeview

-   Contributors welcome

### Many packages doing many different things

-   Data presentation (mapping, visualization, tables, etc.) packages

    -   ggplot2
    -   tmap
    -   gt

-   Packages that extend a presentation package

    -   gtsummary
    -   ggrepel

-   Data management packages

    -   sf
    -   readr

-   Data packages

    -   naturalearth

-   API packages

    -   osmdata
    -   tidygeocoder

-   Place-specific data packages

    -   U.S. specific

        -   tigris
        -   tidycensus
        -   [lehdr](https://jamgreen.github.io/lehdr/index.html) ([repo](https://github.com/jamgreen/lehdr))
        -   [educationdata](https://urbaninstitute.github.io/education-data-package-r/) ([repo](https://github.com/UrbanInstitute/education-data-package-r))

    -   U.S. state specific

        -   wicrash

    -   Other country specific

        -   

    -   City

        -   bcpss

## What I'm making:

-   Place-specific data packages

    -   mapbaltimore (also includes place-specific API access)
    -   bcpss
    -   baltimoredata

-   Improved location support in API packages

    -   crashapi

    -   esri2sf

    -   FlickrAPI

-   Utilities for working with this data

    -   overedge

    -   birdseyeview
